conclusion: I'll solve this step-by-step by determining the power consumed by the circuit and comparing it with 15W.
When switch is open, ammeter reading I₀ = 0.5A
The voltage U remains constant whether switch is open or closed

premise: When the switch is open, the circuit includes only R₁ and the ammeter. Using Ohm's Law: U = I₀ × R₁ = 0.5A × 20Ω
When the switch is closed, the motor (with internal resistance R₂) is connected in parallel with resistance R₁.
conclusion: The equivalent resistance of the circuit becomes: Req = (R₁ × R₂)/(R₁ + R₂) = (20Ω × 10Ω)/(20Ω + 10Ω) = 200Ω/30Ω = 6.67Ω

premise: Using the constant voltage U = 10V and the equivalent resistance Req = 6.67Ω
Since the power consumed by the circuit is exactly 15W
The electric power P consumed by the circuit when the switch is closed is equal to 15W.
conclusion: The electric power P consumed by the circuit is less than 15W.
